About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

ALVIN REY BLANCO

Hi! I'm Vin, an IT Professional currently working in the Philippines specializing in Web Development as Backend Developer.

I am a person who enjoys the simple things in life, a devout Christian and tries to practice the minimalist lifestyle. I am a competitive person and believe in the old adage that humans should thrive and not just survive.

In my free time, I love to do physical activities such as long distance cycling and swimming. I also love listening to Original Pinoy Music (OPM).

Graduated of Bachelor of Science in Computer Science 2006-2010.

Completed 6 months Coding Bootcamp for Web Development from November 2018 to May 2019 in Tuitt.

Salarium

Backend Developer (August 2019 to Oct 2020 )

Salarium main product is Payroll Software System. It is a software that makes the payroll and attendance computation very easy. From clock-in to payout, the system have tools and features to monitor employees time-in and time-outs, process payroll in a few clicks, and secure payouts.

The design of the application is based on microservices architecture. It's composed of several services written on Python and PHP.

As backend developers, one must be familiar with different frameworks such as Laravel, Tornado, Chalice, and Celery.

We were also trained to use a set of tools such as Docker, Redis, and RabbitMQ.

My job is to developed new features, and support works.

Our team follows Agile Development Methodology. We follow 3 weeks sprint and a daily standup on morning. First two days of sprint are intended for planning and collaboration. During planning, our goals are, to identify the scope of each tasks, provide estimate when possible, identify the capacity of the team, know priorities, and everyone is aligned.

The remaining days are allocated for development, testing, documentation, and retrospective. On retrospective, the team will evaluate the performance of the team, list down the things that what went well, what went wrong, and things to be improved.

Oztech Software Resources Philippines, Inc.

Progress Developer/Analyst (July 2012 - July 2019)

Oztech specialises in providing offshore IT Staff Recruiting Services. Our client were Australians.
We developed an Enterprise Resource Planning Application. It is a system and software packages to manage day-to-day business activities such as accounting, purchasing, selling, and inventory.

For 7 years working in Oztech, I became very familiar with the products and became in-charge of dealing with high billable works and resolving complicated bugs. We are maintaining two major products. One is a legacy system running for 3 decades while the other one is a web application.
